content:
Hello,
where I can find the meeting schedule? I'd love to listen in and take some notes.
I don't believe that there are regular meetings. The development of this project is slow enough that it can be handled just through zulip.

these are the ones I know of:
https://lang-team.rust-lang.org/calendar.html
https://rust-lang.github.io/compiler-team/
https://github.com/rust-lang/libs-team#quick-facts
https://calendar.google.com/calendar/embed?showTitle=0&showPrint=0&showTabs=0&showCalendars=0&mode=AGENDA&height=400&wkst=1&bgcolor=%23FFFFFF&src=apd9vmbc22egenmtu5l6c5jbfc%40group.calendar.google.com&color=%23691426&ctz=Europe%2FMadrid
there are also private events and possibly private calendars as well
you probably want this one: https://github.com/rust-lang/libs-team#quick-facts since this is a libs project
Much obliged. Libs meetings are held in text on Zulip, right?
Actually it looks like those are just the meeting notes. No idea where the meetings themselves are, or if they're open.

If that's mainly in zulip, could you refer me to a thread that's a good starting point for immersing myself in it? I searched around but came up with naught, and you can't meaningfully "scroll to top" in a stream it seems.
all or almost-all of the teams have project boards: https://github.com/rust-lang/libs-team/projects/2
not sure that's a perfect example but I think might get support for some kind of organization or review effort of those items which would be both a contribution and a learning exercise :cake:
